name: Devil, Infernal Tutor
damage_resistances: cold; bludgeoning, piercing & slashing from nonmagical attacks not made w/silvered weapons

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Three Claws or Tutor's Batons or one Claw and two Tutor's Batons. It can replace one attack with Spellcasting.

actions.name: Claw (True Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, 5 ft., one target, 12 (2d8+3) slashing damage + 14 (4d6) psychic.

actions.name: Tutor's Baton
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, 5 ft., one target, 10 (2d6+3) bludgeoning damage + 14 (4d6) psychic. Instead of dealing psychic damage tutor can cause target to be incapacitated until target's next turn ends.

actions.name: Fiendish Indoctrination (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Speaks fiendish ideals couched in persuasive scholarly language. Each creature within 30' of tutor: 45 (13d6) psychic and is charmed for 1 min (DC 18 Cha half damage isn't charmed). Charmed creature isn't under tutor's control but regards tutor as a trusted friend taking tutor's requests or actions in most favorable way it can. Charmed creature can re-save at end of each of its turns success ends effect on itself. A creature that fails the save by 5+ is charmed for 1 day instead. Such a creature can re-save only when it suffers harm or receives a suicidal command ending effect on a success.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.desc: Cha (DC 18) no material components: At will: bane calm emotions command detect thoughts suggestion3/day ea: bestow curse compulsion enthrall1/day ea: geas modify memory

special_abilities.name: Devil's Sight
special_abilities.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede its darkvision.

special_abilities.name: Phrenic Weapons
special_abilities.desc: Its weapon attacks are magical. When it hits with any weapon extra 4d6 psychic (included below).

special_abilities.name: Weaken Resolve
special_abilities.desc: Its speech has subtle enchantments that make it seem logical or profound regardless of words used. It has advantage on Cha (Deception) and Cha (Persuasion) checks vs. Humanoids. Also if tutor spends 1+ min conversing with Humanoid that creature has disadvantage on saves vs. tutor's Fiendish Indoctrination and vs. enchantment spells tutor casts.
